title: MongoDB Backup & Restore
subject: MongoDB
theory: Backups are vital. `mongodump` creates a binary export of data. `mongorestore` imports it. For critical systems, file-system snapshots or Atlas continuous backups are preferred.

interview_questions.question: Is mongodump consistent?
interview_questions.answer: Not by default on a live system (writes happen during dump). use --oplog for consistency.

summary: Regular, tested backups are the safety net against data loss events.
